meanings.definition: To send or guide in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent1: The confused tourist misdirects the lost hiker further into the forest.
meanings.sent2: The faulty GPS misdirects drivers onto closed roads.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel misdirects the cat towards the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The magician misdirects the audience's attention to his right hand while performing a trick with his left.
meanings.sent5: The faulty signpost misdirects travelers, causing them to take the longer route.

meanings.definition: To give false or misleading information.
meanings.sent1: The scammer misdirects unsuspecting victims with promises of easy money.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid misdirects readers with sensationalized headlines.
meanings.sent3: The prankster misdirects his friends by pretending to be someone else on the phone.
meanings.sent4: The false witness misdirects the court with fabricated testimony.
meanings.sent5: The con artist misdirects investors by inflating the value of the company.

meanings.sent1: The cunning fox misdirects the hunting dogs by circling back to its den.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader misdirects his followers with false prophecies.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy misdirects its owner by pretending to have lost a toy.
meanings.sent4: The illusionist misdirects the audience's perception with clever sleight of hand.
meanings.sent5: The conman misdirects his victims by creating a false sense of urgency.
